hc.server.ui

Class Dialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • hc.server.ui.Dialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible

    public class Dialog
extends JPanel
    Dialog is a top-level JPanel, locate at center of mobile client.
    and it is typically used for inputs from user.

    if there is a alert message, question or other dialog is showing and not closed,
    the dialog will be delayed to show.

    1. to send a dialog instance for current session,
    please invoke ProjectContext.sendDialogWhenInSession(Dialog).
    2. to send a user defined dialog (NOT instance) to all session for project level,
    please invoke ProjectContext.sendDialogByBuilding(Runnable).
    if a JComponent of one session replies, then the same dialog(s) in other sessions will be dismissed.

    setting CSS for JComponents in dialog is as same as HTMLMlet.

    Tip : to load and execute JavaScript, please use ScriptPanel.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • go

        public void go(String url)
        dismiss current dialog, and jump mobile to following targets:
        1. URL_SCREEN : enter the desktop screen of server from mobile,
        2. form://myMlet : open and show a form,
        3. controller://myctrl : open and show a controller,
        4. URL_EXIT : dismiss current Dialog,
        5. cmd://myCmd : run script commands and dismiss dialog,

        bring to top :
        1. jump to form://B from form://A,
        2. ready jump to form://A again from form://B.
        3. system will bring the target (form://A) to top if it is opened.

        Note :
        go to external URL (for example, http://homecenter.mobi), invoke goExternalURL(String).
        Parameters:
        url -
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        go(String, String), goMlet(Mlet, String), Mlet.setAutoReleaseAfterGo(boolean), goExternalURL(String, boolean)

      • go

        public void go(String scheme,
      String elementID)
        dismiss current dialog, and go/run target URL by elementID.

        jump mobile to following targets:
        1. URL_SCREEN : enter the desktop screen of server from mobile,
        2. form://myMlet : open and show a form,
        3. controller://myctrl : open and show a controller,
        4. URL_EXIT : dismiss current Dialog, it is recommended to use dismiss(),
        5. cmd://myCmd : run script commands and dismiss dialog,

        bring to top :
        1. jump to form://B from form://A,
        2. ready jump to form://A again from form://B.
        3. system will bring the target (form://A) to top if it is opened.

        Note :
        go to external URL (for example, http://homecenter.mobi), invoke goExternalURL(String).
        Parameters:
        scheme - one of MenuItem.CMD_SCHEME, MenuItem.CONTROLLER_SCHEME, MenuItem.FORM_SCHEME or MenuItem.SCREEN_SCHEME.
        elementID - for example, run scripts of menu item "cmd://myCommand", the scheme is MenuItem.CMD_SCHEME, and element ID is "myCommand",
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        go(String)

      • goExternalURL

        public void goExternalURL(String url)
        dismiss current dialog, and go to external URL in client application.

        Important :
        socket/connect permissions is required even if the domain of external URL is the same with the domain of upgrade HAR project URL.

        Warning :
        1. the external URL may be sniffed when in moving (exclude HTTPS).
        2. iOS 9 and above must use secure URLs.
        Parameters:
        url - for example : https://homecenter.mobi
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        goExternalURL(String, boolean)

      • goExternalURL

        public void goExternalURL(String url,
                 boolean isUseExtBrowser)
        deprecated, replaced by goExternalURL(String).

        dismiss current dialog, and go to external URL in system web browser or client application.

        Important :
        socket/connect permissions is required even if the domain of external URL is the same with the domain of upgrade HAR project URL.

        Warning :
        1. the external URL may be sniffed when in moving (exclude HTTPS).
        2. iOS 9 and above must use secure URLs.
        3. In iOS (not Android), when go external URL and isUseExtBrowser is true, the application will be turn into background and released after seconds. In future, it maybe keep alive in background.
        Parameters:
        url -
        isUseExtBrowser - true : use system web browser to open URL; false : the URL will be opened in client application and still keep foreground.
        Since:
        7.7

      • goMlet

        public void goMlet(Mlet toMlet,
          String targetOfMlet)
        dismiss current dialog, and go and open a Mlet or HTMLMlet (which is probably created by ProjectContext.eval(String)).

        the target of toMlet will be set as targetOfMlet.

        Important :
        if the same name target or form://target is opened, then it will be brought to top.
        for more, see go(String).
        Parameters:
        toMlet -
        targetOfMlet - target of Mlet. The prefix form:// is NOT required.
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.eval(String), go(String)

      • loadCSS

        public void loadCSS(String styles)
        load special styles for current Dialog, it must be invoked before setCSS(JComponent, String, String) which refer to these styles.

        More about CSS styles :
        1. the CSS Styles tree node in designer is shared to all HTMLMlet/Dialogs in same project. In other words, it will be loaded automatically by server for each HTMLMlet/Dialog.
        2. this method can be invoked as many times as you want.
        3. this method can be invoked also in constructor method (the initialize method in JRuby).

        About cache :
        don't worry about styles too large for re-translating to mobile,
        the cache subsystem of HomeCenter will intelligence analysis to determine whether transmission or loading cache from mobile (if styles is too small, it will not be cached). What you should do is put more data into one style file, because if there is too much pieces of cache in a project, system will automatically clear the cache and restart caching.
        Parameters:
        styles - for example, "h1 {color:red} p {color:blue}".
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        setCSS(JComponent, String, String), setCSSForToggle(JToggleButton, String, String), setCSSForDiv(JComponent, String, String)

      • resizeImage

        public static final BufferedImage resizeImage(BufferedImage src,
                        int to_width,
                        int to_height)
        resize a BufferedImage to the target size.
        Parameters:
        src -
        to_width -
        to_height -
        Returns:
        the resized image.
        Since:
        7.30

      • setCSS

        public void setCSS(JComponent component,
          String className,
          String styles)
        set CSS class and/or CSS style for JComponent.

        it is effective immediately to mobile.
        it is allowed to invoke this method in constructor of HTMLMlet.

        know more :
        1. the effect of CSS depends on the run-time environment of mobile client.
        2. to get environment information about mobile, please invoke ProjectContext.getMobileOS() and ProjectContext.getMobileOSVer().
        3. please resize image and save them in jar first, or invoke resizeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage, int, int). It is not recommend to resize image by your implementation, because the HAR project may be executed on Android server which is NOT standard J2SE.
        4. the best practice is JComponent + LayoutManager + Listener + CSS. (Note : the implementation of Swing/J2SE for Android is differentiated from Oracle J2SE, if your HAR runs in Android server).
        5. if your UI is ugly, please ask your CSS artist for pleasantly surprised!

        Swing JComponents are translated to HTML like following:
        JComponenttranslated HTMLavailablenote
        JPanel<div></div> setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => div
        setCSSForToggle         		 
        JButton<div>
          <button type='button'>
            <img />
          </button>
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => button
        setCSSForToggle         		the image of JButton is optional
        JCheckBox<div>
          <input type='checkbox'/>
          <label />
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSSForToggle => input
        setCSS => label         		 
        JRadioButton<div>
          <input type='radio'/>
          <label />
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSSForToggle => input
        setCSS => label         		 
        JLabel<div>
          <img />
          <label />
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => label
        setCSSForToggle         		the image of JLable is optional
        JTextField<div>
          <input type='text|password'/>
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => input
        setCSSForToggle         		 
        JTextArea
        JTextPane        		<div>
          <textarea/>
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => textarea
        setCSSForToggle         		 
        JComboBox<div>
          <select >
            </option></option>
          </select>
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => select
        setCSSForToggle         		 
        JProgressBar<div>
          <progress />
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => progress
        setCSSForToggle         		progress is tag in HTML5, so
        Android 4.4 (or above) or iPhone 4s (or above) is required.
        CAUTION : there is no 'min' attribute in progress.
        JSlider<div>
          <input type='range'/>
        </div>        		 setCSSForDiv => div
        setCSS => input
        setCSSForToggle         		the 'range' is tag in HTML5,
        Android 4.4 (or above) or iPhone 4s (or above) is required.
        CAUTION : for Android Server (NOT Android client), SeekBar is used to render JSlider and there is no 'min' field in SeekBar.

        in general,
        1. setCSSForDiv is for the div tag of JComponent, there is a div for each JComponent for location and size.
        2. the location is set to the left(relative to the parent div),top(relative to the parent div), width, height of div.
        3. setCSSForToggle is for the input tag of JCheckBox or JRadioButton,
        4. setCSS is just for JComponent, maybe for div if it is JPanel, maybe for label if it is JLabel.
        5. visible : getElementById({div}).style.visibility='visible';
        6. invisible : getElementById({div}).style.visibility='hidden';
        7. enable : getElementById({input|label|selection|progress}).disabled = false;
        8. disable : getElementById({input|label|selection|progress}).disabled = true;
        9. readonly : getElementById({input|label|selection|progress}).setAttribute('readonly', 'readonly');
        10. editable : getElementById({input|label|selection|progress}).removeAttribute('readonly');
        11. NOT all JComponents are supported.
        Parameters:
        component - the JComponent to set style.
        className - the class name of styles defined Resources/CSS Styles in designer or loadCSS(String). Null for ignore and keep old value. Empty string for clear.
        styles - the styles defined Resources/CSS Styles in designer or loadCSS(String). Null for ignore and keep old value. Empty string for clear.
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        setCSSForDiv(JComponent, String, String), setCSSForToggle(JToggleButton, String, String)

      • setCSSByClass

        public void setCSSByClass(JComponent component,
                 String className)
        set CSS class for JComponent, it's div and it's toggle (if exists) with one step.

        for example, defines CSS for JButton as following :

        div.btnStyle {
          padding:3px;
        }

        button.btnStyle {
          color:blue;
        }

        invoking setCSSByClass(btn, "btnStyle") is same with invoking setCSSForDiv(btn, "btnStyle", null) and setCSS(btn, "btnStyle", null).
        Parameters:
        component - the JComponent to set CSS class.
        className - the class name of styles defined Resources/CSS Styles in designer or loadCSS(String). Do nothing if Null. Empty string for clear.
        Since:
        7.32
        See Also:
        setCSSForDiv(JComponent, String, String), setCSS(JComponent, String, String), setCSSForToggle(JToggleButton, String, String)

      • setCSSForDiv

        public void setCSSForDiv(JComponent component,
                String className,
                String styles)
        set CSS class and/or CSS style for HTML div tag of JComponent.

        for more, see setCSS(JComponent, String, String).
        Parameters:
        component - the JComponent to set style.
        className - the class name of styles defined Resources/CSS Styles in designer or loadCSS(String). Null for ignore and keep old value. Empty string for clear.
        styles - the styles defined Resources/CSS Styles in designer or loadCSS(String). Null for ignore and keep old value. Empty string for clear.
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        setCSS(JComponent, String, String), setCSSForToggle(JToggleButton, String, String)

      • setCSSForToggle

        public void setCSSForToggle(JToggleButton togButton,
                   String className,
                   String styles)
        set CSS class and/or CSS style for the HTML input tag of JCheckBox and JRadioButton.

        for more, see setCSS(JComponent, String, String).
        Parameters:
        togButton - the JComponent (JCheckBox or JRadioButton) to set style.
        className - the class name of styles defined Resources/CSS Styles in designer or loadCSS(String). Null for ignore and keep old value. Empty string for clear.
        styles - the styles defined Resources/CSS Styles in designer or loadCSS(String). Null for ignore and keep old value. Empty string for clear.
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        setCSSForDiv(JComponent, String, String), setCSS(JComponent, String, String)

      • setRTL

        public void setRTL(JComponent component,
          boolean isRTL)
        set attribute 'dir' for a div of JComponent.

        Know more :
        1. a Dialog will be set RTL by server for the entire page if language of mobile is RTL.
        2. in some case, a JComponent may be set RTL/LTR different from the entire page.
        Parameters:
        component -
        isRTL - true means right to left, false means left to right.
        Since:
        7.40

      • toHexColor

        public static final String toHexColor(int color,
                boolean useAlpha)
        convert a int color to hex string.

        for example :
        1. toHexColor(0x0000AABB, false) returns "00aabb",
        2. toHexColor(0x0000AABB, true) returns "0000aabb",
        3. toHexColor(0xAABBCCDD, false) returns "bbccdd",
        4. toHexColor(0xAABBCCDD, true) returns "aabbccdd",
        Parameters:
        color -
        useAlpha - true, use the alpha channel.
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.30
